description: Since 2023, the Paris prosecutor's office has opened nine investigations in connection with acts committed on French soil aimed at deepening societal divides over the Israeli-Palestinian conflict and the war in Ukraine.

description: Romania's defense ministry said Saturday that the country's airspace had been breached by a drone during a Russian attack on infrastructure in neighboring Ukraine.

headline: Israeli intelligence admits Iran's nuclear program has not been destroyed
description: Israeli officials have recently provided French authorities with their own assessment of the airstrikes that targeted Tehran's nuclear arsenal in June. This information is particularly valuable to France after American intelligence agencies have halted all cooperation with their European partners regarding the Iranian nuclear program.

headline: Audenge, home to Europe's largest seawater swimming pool
description: 'Aquatic Monuments' (3/6). Le Monde brings you to French public pools with exceptional architecture. In the Landes de Gascogne Regional Natural Park, a former 19th-century hunting basin has become the largest seawater swimming pool in Europe. Since the 1920s, residents of Audenge and neighboring towns have come here for swimming lessons, to enjoy oysters, and to relax in the shade of towering trees.

headline: Nan Goldin, photographer: 'The camera gave me a voice, and a way in'
description: 'I wouldn't be here if...' Each week, Le Monde asks a public figure about a decisive moment in their life. The American photographer reflects on her sister's suicide, which changed her view of the world.

When everyday hatred turns to racist murder: 'I don't know why I lost it. I have no idea'
description: On May 31, Christophe Belgembe, a mechanic, fatally shot his neighbor Hichem Miraoui and tried to kill five other people in the southern French town of Puget-sur-Argens. Though he had made racist remarks for years, he struggled to explain his actions.
byline: Jérôme Lefilliâtre and  Lorraine de Foucher

headline: Economist Gabriel Zucman: 'France's new PM will have to address the proposed tax on the ultra-rich'
description: Zucman is the architect behind the proposal to tax the wealthiest individuals, a measure championed by the left. 'It will be very difficult to ask the French people to make sacrifices as long as billionaires pay so little in taxes,' he told Le Monde in an interview.

headline: A new exhibition brings the Paris suburbs from the outside to the forefront
description: The exhibit at the Museum of Immigration in Paris cleverly focuses on a few moments and places to address the many social, political and economic issues associated with these neglected areas.
